citations.desc: Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers.
citations.narrative:
An adult German Shepherd Dog, "Shadow," was being held for a flight departure from LAS to JFK on flight AA0311 on
March 07, 2025 (AWB 001-98854136). On the outside of the enclosure was a form with a space for a certification by the
consignor of the last time food and water was offered and for feeding instructions over a 24-hour period, but that section
of the form was not completed. Also, the consignor’s signature was provided on the form but there was no indication of
date and time it was signed. A complete certification with the required information and feeding and watering instructions
are important to ensure the animal's health and well-being during transport. Carriers and intermediate handlers must not
accept a dog for transport in commerce unless the consignor certifies in writing that the dog was offered food and water
within 4 hours of transport and provides specific instructions for feeding and watering in a 24-hour period. The certification
and instructions must be securely attached to the outside of the enclosure and easily read.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a cargo facility manager.
n

narrative:
3.14(c) 
   
Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers. 
An adult German Shepherd Dog, "Shadow," was being held for a flight departure from LAS to JFK on flight AA0311 on 
March 07, 2025 (AWB 001-98854136). On the outside of the enclosure was a form with a space for a certification by the 
consignor of the last time food and water was offered and for feeding instructions over a 24-hour period, but that section 
of the form was not completed. Also, the consignor’s signature was provided on the form but there was no indication of 
date and time it was signed. A complete certification with the required information and feeding and watering instructions 
are important to ensure the animal's health and well-being during transport. Carriers and intermediate handlers must not 
accept a dog for transport in commerce unless the consignor certifies in writing that the dog was offered food and water 
within 4 hours of transport and provides specific instructions for feeding and watering in a 24-hour period. The certification 
and instructions must be securely attached to the outside of the enclosure and easily read. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a cargo facility manager.
